com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk

Class SingleSampleChunkSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.SingleSampleChunkSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChunkSource

    public class SingleSampleChunkSource
extends Object
implements ChunkSource
    A chunk source that provides a single chunk containing a single sample.

    An example use case for this implementation is to act as the source for loading out-of-band subtitles, where subtitles for the entire video are delivered as a single file.

      • SingleSampleChunkSource

        public SingleSampleChunkSource(DataSource dataSource,
                       DataSpec dataSpec,
                       Format format,
                       long durationUs,
                       MediaFormat mediaFormat)
        Parameters:
        dataSource - A DataSource suitable for loading the sample data.
        dataSpec - Defines the location of the sample.
        format - The format of the sample.
        durationUs - The duration of the sample in microseconds, or C.UNKNOWN_TIME_US if the duration is unknown, or C.MATCH_LONGEST_US if the duration should match the duration of the longest track whose duration is known.
        mediaFormat - The sample media format. May be null.

      • getChunkOperation

        public void getChunkOperation(List<? extends MediaChunk> queue,
                     long seekPositionUs,
                     long playbackPositionUs,
                     ChunkOperationHolder out)
        Description copied from interface: ChunkSource
        Updates the provided ChunkOperationHolder to contain the next operation that should be performed by the calling ChunkSampleSource.

        The next operation comprises of a possibly shortened queue length (shortened if the implementation wishes for the caller to discard MediaChunks from the queue), together with the next Chunk to load. The next chunk may be a MediaChunk to be added to the queue, or another Chunk type (e.g. to load initialization data), or null if the source is not able to provide a chunk in its current state.

        Specified by:
        getChunkOperation in interface ChunkSource
        Parameters:
        queue - A representation of the currently buffered MediaChunks.
        seekPositionUs - If the queue is empty, this parameter must specify the seek position. If the queue is non-empty then this parameter is ignored.
        playbackPositionUs - The current playback position.
        out - A holder for the next operation, whose ChunkOperationHolder.queueSize is initially equal to the length of the queue, and whose ChunkOperationHolder.chunk is initially equal to null or a Chunk previously supplied by the ChunkSource that the caller has not yet finished loading. In the latter case the chunk can either be replaced or left unchanged. Note that leaving the chunk unchanged is both preferred and more efficient than replacing it with a new but identical chunk.

      • disable

      • getError

        public IOException getError()
        Description copied from interface: ChunkSource
        If the ChunkSource is currently unable to provide chunks through ChunkSource.getChunkOperation(java.util.List<? extends com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.MediaChunk>, long, long, com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkOperationHolder), then this method returns the underlying cause. Returns null otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getError in interface ChunkSource
        Returns:
        An IOException, or null.
